definition[0]: to relax and stop feeling anxious
example[0]: a beautiful country hotel that is the perfect place to unwind
definition[1]: to undo something that has been wrapped around something else, or to become undone after being wrapped around something
example[1]: She started to unwind her scarf.
definition[2]: to sell bonds, shares etc because you think their price will fall
example[2]: Investors decided to unwind their money-losing long-term bond positions, using proceeds to buy short-term securities.
definition[3]: to obtain the bonds, shares etc that you borrowed to sell, and deliver them
example[3]: When the market rose instead of falling, these speculators rushed to unwind their short positions.
